facts.text: Dad has the babies, not Mom! Male seahorses have a special pouch where they carry eggs until they hatch.
I'm a really bad swimmer! I use my tiny dorsal fin to move, fluttering it up to 35 times per second.
I don't have a stomach! Food goes straight through me, so I have to eat almost constantly to survive.
My tail works like a monkey's! I can grip onto seagrass and coral so I don't float away in currents.
Seahorse couples do a special dance every morning! They swim side by side and change colors to say hello.

profile.habitat: Seagrass beds and coral reefs worldwide
